mixed-citation.article-title: Systematic revision of the pantropical whip spider family Charinidae Quintero, 1986 (Arachnida, Amblypygi)

tp:treatment-sec.p:
Charinus magua
Seiter et al ., 2018: 350–359
, figs 1–8.

Based in part on
Seiter et al. (2018)
, this species may be separated from other Caribbean and Central American
Charinus
by means of the following combination of characters: median eyes absent and lateral eyes reduced; cheliceral claw with 2–4 teeth; female gonopods cushion-like with lateral projections directed posteriorly and unsclerotized; tibia of leg I with 21 or 22 articles, tarsus I with 37 or 38 articles; first tarsal article about five times as long as second article; pedipalp femur with three dorsal spines and two ventral spines; pedipalp patella with three dorsal spines and two ventral spines; leg IV basitibia with three pseudo-articles; leg IV distitibia with 16 trichobothria; trichobothrium bc situated closer to bf than to sbf .

Noun in apposition taken from the historical Taíno chiefdom of
Maguá (
Seiter et al. 2018
)
.
